It nicely closes and ties together the story. I loved the ending.

It's different than the previous 2 instalments. You're no longer in a closed dark space, the world is brighter and more open. You don't carry around medkits anymore, there's no manual saving (auto save mechanics), you can only carry 2 weapons at the same time (you can easily find a new one pretty much anywhere). Most of all it did not crash at all for me, unlike bioshock 1 and 2.

BioShock Infinite while not a sequel or prequel to BioShock 1 or 2 is still an amazing game. No longer being confined to the underwater city of Rapture Infinite tackles a new city in the sky. The guns feel different and are great to fire and the iconic Plasmids now renamed Vigors have been completley reworked with most Vigors having a secondary charged up shot that places a trap imbued with that Vigor's effects. BioShock Infinite feels fresh and new. The 2 part DLC Burial At Sea also wonderfuly wraps up Rapture and ties the first 2 games together. Overall a great game with great DLC.
Uma obra de arte, o final buga a mente mas o  jogo é completamente foda.

nice

Gold... May even say it was better then the first installment of Bioshock but that would anger a lot of people. Engaging environments, rich story (my god the story was fucking amazing), meaningful DLC (DLC is necessary when you purchase the game). I could go on and on describing the masterpiece that this game was and wish it received more attention as this was truly a piece of art.

Totally love the story and the character, especially Elizabeth is just awesome. My Favorite part of all Bioshock games. They improved the gameplay, they took the whole concept on a new level and in a new setting and it just worked. You gotta play it.
Tavsiye ederim 15 liranın altında alınabilecek az bulunan güzel oyundan bir tanesi
Es un juego extremadamente bueno y con una de las mejores historias que conozco

Either make an open world rpg with loot to be found in hidden places, OR make a fast paced shooter.
You can't have both.
This game wants to be a fast paced shooter, but meanwhile punishes you for not checking out every f?!cking door you run past. The gameworld is littered with useless stuff (hot dogs, pop corn, ammo for weapons you don't carry), but sometimes, important items like permanent health boosts are stuffed away in seemingly meaningless locations (behind/under furniture, so we have to spend time searching easter eggs, really?  Crouching behind every bench, closet and desk kinda takes the pace out of a shootout).

Imagine John Wick being in a high speed car chase.
The only catch is, he's got to stop and go inside every house he passes, for some arbitrary purpose.

This loot mechanism wouldn't be so much of a problem if the game were an open world survival-like shooter, like Fallout, which is more or less based upon finding better loot all the time.
However, the gameplay is entirely linear, which means no going back to past areas, so if you've run past important permanent boosts, that's bad luck. 

The result is you just end up searching countless toilets, hot dog carts, office drawers, etc.
That's a shame, because the action, when there actually IS action, is pretty good.
There's just too much nothingness in between.
As it is, I find the game to be a trash can searching simulator with some good shooting as a side game.

They also put in some chapters with hardly ANY shooting.
Just some walking/searching and dialogue.
To build depth, immersion, and story, I suppose.
The problem, however, is that the searching, the dialogues, etc are shallow, not immersive and unrewarding.

The final problem I'm having with this game:
Where the original BioShock took place in a deserted game world, with hardly any sane survivors left, BioShock Infinite takes place in a fully populated society.
However, there's zero interaction between player and environment, which feels very, very odd.
You wanna grab someone's snack from under their noses for a quick HP-boost? Sure, no problem...
Either include NPC's and make them add to immersion (like in FallOut), or leave them out entirely, like in the earlier BioShock games. 
This game makes you feel like you're a thoroughly autistic maniac who just found a gun in a trash can on a square full of other thoroughly autistic robots.

Der würdige dritte Teil der bioshock Reihe, auch wenn es sich Neues wagt.
Mittlerweile schwächelnden das Spiel in seiner Optik und schon damals konnte man den Stil und die linearität bemängeln aber auch wie damals fasziniert Infinite und ist trotz seines eigenen Weges ein würdiges Bioshock
前面有多心动后面就有多难受，拯救平行宇宙干嘛，我只想拯救眼前的这个伊丽莎白然后幸福地生活在一起……

我是被这个游戏天空城的背景吸引入坑的。说实话，第一次进入游戏的时候觉得很惊艳。但随着游戏进度的推进天空城带来的惊艳感是越来越淡。
       虽然不应该以现在的眼光去评价以前的游戏，但说实话，游戏的地图互动的地方感觉很少（或许是我没找到），这是我觉得最遗憾的地方。游戏的战斗强度个人觉得比较高，子弹非常吃紧，不过好在伊丽莎白真的给力（打架发枪，打完发钱，感觉自己是个打工人）。
       总的来说，作为一款老游戏也许还行，但以现在的眼光来看很一般。
游戏节奏很紧凑。玩到后面安娜被抓了，真的就想把她救出来。挺好的一部作品，唯一让我觉得难受的就是子弹，感觉全程子弹都不够用，打的紧巴巴的。
Great game

Decent solo game. could use a few updates to make the game a bit more "appetizing" towards the end

I'm not sure how other people are saying this game is good & the story is brilliant. The story is garbage & makes no sense at all. Now, before I get piled on for saying this, make no mistake, I understood the story line. It just didn't make any sense & is riddled with plot holes. It doesn't fit in with either Bioshock games, but they tried to make it fit in, unsuccessfully. The game itself was boring & the only reason I put so many hours into it was for the achievements.

There was a couple of good things about this game: Songbird was pretty cool, the graphics are amazing & the voice acting was pretty good. That's pretty much about it. Elizabeth was annoying & just like any other NPC made to follow you around, just constantly got in the way which was infuriating. No 'New Game +' just like Bioshock 2 which annoyed the hell out of me in both games, so you can't upgrade everything that wasn't fully upgraded in the first play through, in the second play through. Guns were under powered, even if you upgraded them fully and you can only hold 2 at any one time. Vox weapons were not even worth bothering with as they all sucked. Plasmids, or Vigors as they're called in this, were mostly boring. Murder of Crows (this games version of the bee Plasmid), Devils Kiss (the fire Plasmid) & Shock Jockey (electric Plasmid) were the only ones even worth using. You can only have 2 'active' Vigors going at any one given time, you can change them to any of the other Vigors, but like i said, only 2 'active'. Level design was terrible and is extremely linear.

I didn't mind the City in the Clouds DLC as it was probably the best part of the entire game, and it's basically just a challenge wave DLC. Burial at Sea part 1 & 2 were just terrible and just made the story worse, which is saying something.

I would only recommend buying this game if it's part of the Bioshock Collection pack and only when said pack is on sale. Otherwise, don't bother. It's a prequel and doesn't fit in with the story of Bioshock 1 or 2, barely even has the feel of a Bioshock game.

I liked this one more than 1 & 2 except I found vigors mostly useless (except mind control one). In BS1/2 they were more powerful. On the other hand shooting is much more satisfying (carabine + volley gun were my favorite), spaces are larger and more open compared to tight corridors of first 2 games. Also I wish I could carry more than 2 weapons.

I also found boss/miniboss fights more challenging, which is nice change, b/c in bs1 I could just stun big daddies to death without any effort.

Gameplay - 7/10
Story - 9/10
The gameplay is pretty good, although a bit lacking in a few aspects when compared to the previous instalments. The story and art style are the main focus and it did NOT disappoint one bit. Still "The Burial at the Sea" dlc complicated things way more than it needed to be and we probably would have been better off with a simpler dlc. All in all, I'd say its still far better than the plot of Bioshock 2 which was garbage (Minerva's Den was good).
A MASTERPIECE, one of the best games I've ever played

Bu oyunda Booker DeWitt'in kızı getir borçların silinsin notuyla Columbia'ya giderek Elizabethi tanıyıp macerayı başlatıyoruz. Bununla da kalmayıp kendini peygamber ilan eden Vox Pauli ile de mücadele ediyoruz. Oyun genel hatlarıyla bunun üzerine kurulmasıyla beraber bu yer yer insanı etkileyecek senaryonun dışında oyunun en harika yanı çevre dizaynı. Bu kadar birbirine uyumlu renkler ve çevre yerleştirmesi şu oyun kadar yapamadı ya. Oyunun geçtiği yer sanki cennetten bir köşe. Her detayı izlemeden insan duramıyor. Hani görevi sallayıp çevreyi izleyip huzur bulduğum bir atmosferi var. Sadece renk paleti çevre dizaynı değil oyundaki npclerde oyunun yaşayan dünyasını size hissettiriyor. Cıvıl cıvıl bir dünya etkileyici bir hikaye sunan bu oyun grafikleriyle de günümüzdeki oyunlarla kıyaslanabilecek bir hatra sahip. Daha önce bu oyunu oynamadıysan çok şey kaçırmışsınızdır

Comprenlo, 10/10

Comments:
Bugs - I did have some audio issues, though it seems to only happen when taking screenshots using F12. The sound becomes static and cracking. Easy fix, restart the game. Unsure if GeForce Experience (ALT+F2) screenshots also cause this.

The game also fails to explain that there is a Gameplay Menu, that is NOT the ESC > Gameplay menu. Press "O" to access this. I didn't know about it until just before the final section [spoiler] when you save Elizabeth by shutting off the generators in the tower [/spoiler]. And I also don't recall it telling you hold "Q" to access a radial menu for your Vigors (I was very confused why there was no option to switch them at the Vigor Vendors). 

Besides these two issues, the story is honestly probably the best out of all three. This does take place prior to Bioshock 1 (1912) BUT I played in order of release, it didn't really feel like Infinite was a prequel [spoiler] though you do see the beginning section of Rapture, and the Lighthouse and funny enough, Booker states "City at the bottom of the ocean? Ridiculous" AFTER COMING FROM A LITERALLY PHYSICS DEFYING FLOATING CITY[/spoiler].
worst game ever

esse é com certeza um dos bioshocks já feitos

После прохождения этой игры, у меня появились смешанные чувства насчет сея продукта геймдева. Первые две части Bioshock мне на 100% зашли. Фишка первых частей была в самом Восторге(хотя в Колумбии из нового это айро-трассы и красивый вид на облака и всё на этом) атмосфера, флора и фауна  подводного города где одновременно тебе страшно зайти куда либо боясь что из темного угла выскочит какой нибудь мутант-паук и ты можешь наложить в штаны и после можно просто повернуть голову и посмотреть на прекрасный подводный мир. А потом после Восторга нас вообще выбрасывают в воздушный город. Я вообще почти не нашел интересного для себя, это оказался просто город с красивыми видами на облака и небо. У нас есть главный герой Девид Букер пожалуй самый не интересный герой в всей серии, (мне больше всего нравиться Отец или Альфа из 2 части) он сам по себе скучный. Я сейчас вам несколькими словами опишу почти все диалоги гг : Элизабед, стой, поговорить, справимся, неважно. И все он реально комбинируя эти слова так и говорит целую игру, это нонсенс. Пожалуй из всех персонажей мне понравилась только Элизабед. Говорить про нее не буду всем ясно почему(она топ). Про сюжет я скажу кратко он тут на 50\50. Пол игры ты собираешься сбежать с Элизабед с Колумбии но потом пол игры все таки питаетесь попасть к злодею. И сюжет начинает блистать красками где-то после половины прохождения. Концовка странная но не в плохом смысле. Ну в целом игра хорошая: красивый мир, декорации, тот же вид на небо, стрельба, Элизабед и ее некоторые части. Она просто баба огонь если нужно хилку кинет, патроны, плазмиды. Женился б на ней. Ну а, если подсуммировать всё выше сказанное то игра хорошая  но с рядом минусов. Да это еще и куча того что разрабы вырезали из прошлых частей, просто жаль. Есть еще много чего что я не сказал ибо не хочу затягивать. Надеюсь я чем-то помог и спасибо за внимание.
Вот вам Шрэка под конец чтоб скучно не было.

我主观的评价一下这个游戏，剧情上我还没通关就不说了，就说作为一个第一人称射击游戏这游戏的手感极差，令我感到不适，跑动走动和静止的鼠标灵敏度不一致（移动速度越快越迟缓），机瞄准心不自动回正不能调按住瞄准，斜着还不能跑，fov我目测调到最大只有90度，等等等等，不一而足，这可是2013年的游戏，射击体验上我感觉不如03年的游戏，充满着诡异和反人类设计。如果你和我一样是FPS爱好者是想玩射击打怪类游戏千万不要买这游戏。打枪的体验极差！！！
只能说这游戏震撼到我了

You get so much out of this game.
The main story actually seemed to be a bit short, but I feel that this is no shortcoming - it actually makes a lot of sense to replay the main story after you're done playing it for the first time, because things make more sense and you can catch all the little details. Why not try on a more difficult setting the second time playing?
Not to mention that there are 2 excellent episode DLCs and 1 gamified experience DLC (Clash in the Clouds).
The game itself is very fun to play and the story compelling. I loved the introduction of sky hooks!

I will definitely keep playing this game, it is such a classic at this point. Oh, and the old timey music covers are simply divine, I catch myself playing only the music sometimes. Love it!

Good world design, creative and genuinely storyline, and combat that's challenging but varied and brief enough that it doesn't get too repetitive or grindy. All in all, one of the best shooters I've .played
Es una Obra de arte señores, no duden en comprarlo (si ya jugaron el primer titulo claro esta) no se van a arrepentir
AAA

Apesar de preferir a história e a trilha sonora do primeiro jogo, o infinite ganha nos outros quesitos, como o gráfico, os cenários, a jogabilidade e a otimização. As duas DLCs complementam não só esse jogo, mas também toda a franquia. É um jogo que vale cada centavo e é obrigatório pra qualquer fã de FPS.
От стрельбы под конец устаешь, но в целом все бодро, стильно и вообще симпотная дочурка(ой).
